subject: Critical Thinking
title: Following the Money: Who Funds the Message?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Following the Money: Who Funds the Message?.

hook.text: A study claims sugar isn't harmful. The funder: the Sugar Research Foundation. Coincidence?

buildup.text: Funding bias: research funded by industry is significantly more likely to reach conclusions favorable to the funder.

discovery.text: A systematic review found that industry-funded studies were 4x more likely to report favorable results than independent ones.

climax.text: Always check: Who paid for this research? Do they benefit from the conclusion? Is there independent replication?

punchline.text: Follow the money. It often leads to the motive.

quiz.question: How does funding bias affect research outcomes?
options: Industry-funded studies are significantly more likely to produce funder-favorable results
Funding has no effect on outcomes
